newsitem.title: USA: TVA meets all-time record power demand.
newsitem.headline: TVA meets all-time record power demand.

text.p: The Tennessee Valley Authority said it set two power records, including meeting an all-time power demand, as arctic temperatures and sub-zero wind chills swept through the Tennessee Valley Friday.
Preliminary calculations show a record power demand of more than 26,500 megawatts at 0800 CST/1400 GMT. The previous record peak demand was 25,995 megawatts on February 5, 1996.
Also, for the first time ever, all of TVA's 59 fossil, five nuclear and 113 hydro units were generating power at the same time to meet the peak.
"The decision to bring Watts Bar and Browns Ferry nuclear units into operation was a key factor in helping us meet this record high demand for power by our customers," Chairman Craven Crowell said.

TVA said it met the all-time demand without any curtailments and was still able to help neighboring power systems meet the high demand. The average temperature in the seven-state region at the time of the peak demand was 10 degrees.
Power demand is expected to remain high through the weekend until temperatures moderate across the Valley.
